document.masterDocTitle: Western Hemisphere Lasiochilinae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Anthocoridae) with comments on some extralimital species and some considerations on suprageneric relationships

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Western Hemisphere Lasiochilinae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Anthocoridae) with comments on some extralimital species and some considerations on suprageneric relationships

bibRefCitation.author: Reuter, O. M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Reuter, O. M. (1871) Acanthiidae americanae descriptae. Ofversigt af Kungliga Vetenskapsakademiens Forhandlingar, 28, 557 - 568.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 215–216.
L. (L.) hirtellus .
Male. 215, Copulatory teeth (Cte); 216, Pygophore showing left paramere (LP).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: USA , Canada , Mexico , Belize , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Panama , Cuba , Guadeloupe, Grenada , Puerto Rico , Saint Vincent , Virgin Is., Coco I., Galapagos Is., Argentina , Bolivia , Brazil , Ecuador , Guyana , Paraguay , Peru , Venezuela . ( Fig. 200 ).

Material examined: Holotype USA : ♀ Texas , Belfrage , Mus. Zool. H :fors. Spec. typ. Nº 10361,
Lasiochilus pallidulus
R.. ZMHF
;
Syntypes , 2 ♂ 1 ♀ Equateur , Duran , nº 51,
Cardiastethus aequinoctialis
n. sp. ( Poppius, 1909 ). NHMW
.

Discussion: The type-species of the genus is closely related to
L. hirtellus
but differs by its dorsal coloration, smaller size, different interocular space, and by the more slender and curved left paramere. Author examined the type series of
Cardiastethus aequinoctialis Poppius, 1909
, and he considers it to be a junior synonym of
L. pallidulus .
